reserve.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future
reserve.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
I’d like to reserve a table for two.
reserve.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to keep something so that it can be used by a particular person or for a particular purpose
reserve.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: A separate room is reserved for smokers.
reserve.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to keep part of something for use at a later time during a process – used especially when describing how to cook something
reserve.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Reserve a little of the mixture to sprinkle over the top of the pie.
reserve.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to use or show something only in one particular situation
reserve.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: She spoke in a tone of voice she usually reserved for dealing with officials.
reserve.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed
reserve.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Somehow Debbie maintained an inner reserve of strength.
reserve.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a quality in someone’s character that makes them not like expressing their emotions or talking about their problems
reserve.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: She overcame her own natural reserve.
reserve.translation[1].definitions[2].de: an extra player who plays in a team if one of the other players is injured or ill
reserve.translation[1].definitions[3].de: an area of land where wild animals and plants are protected
reserve.translation[1].definitions[5].de: a price below which something will not be sold, especially in an auction
reserve.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to arrange for a place on a plane, in a hotel, in a restaurant etc to be kept for a customer who will arrive later
reserve.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: He reserved two rooms at the hotel.
reserve.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to keep or restrict something so that it can be used only by a particular person or for a particular purpose
reserve.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Of the total capital, 19% is expected to be reserved for strategic investors.
The local road was to be reserved for traffic which had business in the locality.
reserve.translation[2].definitions[2].de: to state in an agreement, contract etc that you want the opportunity to do something or change something
reserve.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: The company reserved the right to invest directly in some of the movies.
reserve.translation[2].definitions[3].de: a statement put onto printed, recorded, or electronic material to show it is illegal to copy it without special permission
reserve.translation[2].definitions[4].de: to delay a decision or opinion about something until a later date
reserve.translation[2].definitions[4].ex: The five-judge panel will reserve judgement until they see further evidence.
reserve.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a minimum price that a seller will accept, usually in an auction
reserve.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: The painting failed to reach its reserve (=was not sold because the minimum price was not offered).
